meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Get ready for the most epic Octopath Traveler II review that'll leave you in stitches and wanting more!

First off, let me just say that I'm not a professional critic like those fancy-pants folks from GameSpot or Nintendo Life. No way, I'm just a grog trying to have some fun with words! But hey, who says I can't bring the laughs and excitement?

So, what's Octopath Traveler II all about? Well, it's an RPG that's all about... wait for it... OCTOPATHS! Just kidding! (Sort of.) Seriously though, this game is a masterclass in improving upon perfection. It takes everything great from the original and adds some tasty new bits to make it even better.

GameSpot says it builds on what worked, and I'm like, "Yaaas, preach!" They also mention common pillars of design and gameplay – combat mechanics, Path Actions, freeform progress – that'll carry forth through future games. I mean, who doesn't love a good RPG formula?

Meanwhile, Game Informer thinks Octopath Traveler II is a sterling achievement all around. Sterling?! That's like saying my cat is the next big thing (she isn't, but hey, a grog can dream!). Anyway, it means the game is basically awesome.

Vandal agrees, saying this sequel doesn't reinvent the wheel but improves upon pretty much everything to deliver one of the best JRPGs in years. And honestly, who needs a revolution when you've got Octopaths?

Nintendo Life goes all out with praise, calling Octopath Traveler II a triumphant and confident follow-up that builds on established foundations with welcome new ideas. They also mention gorgeous visuals, an incredible soundtrack, and – oh yeah – it's just one of the finest RPGs available!

Game Revolution says it's like a greatest hits album from Square Enix's golden years (yawn), but hey, I'm a grog who loves his JRPGs, so that's okay by me! And SpazioGames basically gives Octopath Traveler II two thumbs up (and then some) for its writing, visuals, and combat system.

Finally, GamingTrend claims it surpasses the original in every way (that's like saying my cat can fly – maybe not, but I'm a grog who loves his RPGs, so that's okay too!

In conclusion, Octopath Traveler II is basically the best JRPG since sliced bread (or pizza). And if you don't agree, well, then we're just gonna have to disagree... or have a friendly battle in-game!

Hippo Penny out!
